body:
Comment 2: 
I guess the reason why weekly-02-22 go compiler on centos 5.7 generate smaller binary is
because the debug info was stripped out.  As it said in following log. But doing a code
listing still list out source code. 

[root@learn hw]# gdb helloworld
GNU gdb (GDB) Red Hat Enterprise Linux (7.0.1-37.el5_7.1)
Copyright (C) 2009 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>;
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
and "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "i386-redhat-linux-gnu".
For bug reporting instructions, please see:
<http://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/bugs/>;...
Reading symbols from /root/gocode/src/hw/helloworld...(no debugging symbols
found)...done.
(gdb) l
1       // cmpout
2
3       // Copyright 2009 The Go Authors. All rights reserved.
4       // Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style
5       // license that can be found in the LICENSE file.
6
7       // Test that we can do page 1 of the C book.
8
9       package main
10
(gdb) l
11      func main() {
12              print("hello, world\n")
13      }
(gdb) l
Line number 14 out of range; /root/gocode/src/hw/helloworld.go has 13 lines.
(gdb)
